content: entwined house socks for ladies designed by margaret macinnis c 2012 sizes s--size 4-10 with smaller ankles customizable cuff is 5 5 as written photo shows without rib m/l size 6-11 with larger ankles customizable cuff is 6 as written photo shows with rib materials worsted superwash sock yarn 110 yds in 50 grams knitpicks superwash swish worsted m/l in cobblestone heather and s in copper 70 gr 100 g more for longer cuff needles size for gauge of 6 st/inch sample knit on 3 5 mm us 4 dpns could also be worked on two circulars or magic loop cable needle yarn needle stitch marker key c4l move next two stitches to a cable needle and drop to the front k2 then k2 from cable needle c4r move next two stitches to a cable needle and drop to the back k2 then k2 from cable needle pm place marker ssk slip one stitch knitwise slip next stitch knitwise slip two together back to left needle knit two slipped stitches together through back loops k2tog knit two stitches together p2tog purl two stitches together sl slip a stitch purlwise unless indicated pw purlwise slip the stitch as if to purl kw knitwise slip a stitch as if to knit entwined house socks for ladies page 1 kfb an increase knit front and back of same st pbf an increase purl back and front of same st notes socks are knit with a cabled cuff and the heel is a classic pigeon flap with turned heel the 4 x 1 ribbing continues on the top of the gusset to the toe but the bottom of the foot is knit in stockinette if you want a snug cuff consider working 1-2 inches of 1 x 1 ribbing before starting the pattern cables the socks are mirrored the cables are worked to the right on the right sock left on the left size s or m/l parentheses instructions for size s are given outside of parentheses and the corresponding size m/l instruction is given inside thus e g cast on 44 50 st instructions left sock cast on 44 50 st divide work on three needles if desired and join in round for those using dpn s suggest 15 14 15 17 17 16 distribution if you are using two circulars for the size s place 20 stitches on one cable and 24 on the other if you are making the size l place 25 sts on each cable rib 1 x 1 for 5 rnds or more if desired increase size s by one st on last round if you are using two circs increase to 25 on the 24 cable for the size s only kfb in one stitch only 45 50 st pattern row round 1-3 k4 p1 around round 4 k4 pbf around 54 60 sts round 5 c4l p2 around round 1a-4a k4 p2 around repeat rnds 1a-4a round 5 two three or more for longer cuff write
